intro: Arctotis fugax, commonly known as the quick-growing arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, gray-green leaves and bright yellow to orange flower heads. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Arctotis fugax is known for its rapid growth and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
